speaker: Prof. Shantanu Bhattacharya
description:
Prof. Shantanu Bhattacharya (Ph.D.) is the Director of CSIR-CSIO Chandigarh and GVMM Chair Professor of Mechanical Engineering at IIT Kanpur. An innovator and entrepreneur, he works at the intersection of nanotechnology and application engineering. 
He holds a Ph.D. from the University of Missouri, Columbia, an M.S. from Texas Tech University, and a B.Tech from Delhi College of Engineering. His research focuses on micro- and nano-sensors, nano-energetic materials, micro/nano-fabrication, photocatalysis for water remediation, and product design.

speaker: Prof. Gaurav Tomar
description: Dr. Gaurav Tomar is a Professor in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) Bangalore. He earned his PhD in 2008 and BTech in 2003, both from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kanpur. His research focuses on multiphase flow simulations, interfacial instabilities, multiscale simulations, and electrohydrodynamics of bubbles and drops. He is also deeply involved in studying complex fluid flows, exploring the dynamics and instabilities that govern these systems.

speaker: Prof. Sandip Kumar Saha
description: Prof. Sandip Kumar Saha is a Professor in the Mechanical Engineering Department at IIT Bombay. He earned his Ph.D. (2009) and M.Sc. (Eng.) (2005) from the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, and his B.E. (2002) from Jadavpur University, Kolkata. He further honed his expertise as a post-doctoral research fellow at KU Leuven. His research spans heat transfer, computational fluid dynamics, renewable energy, energy storage, and multiphase flow, contributing significantly to these fields through advanced simulations and theoretical developments.

speaker: Dr. Rosy
description: Dr. Rosy is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Chemistry at IIT (BHU). She holds a Ph.D. in Electroanalytical Chemistry from the Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, an M.Sc. in Physical Chemistry from Hindu College, University of Delhi, and a B.Sc. in Chemistry (Hons.) from the same institution. Her research interests span electrochemistry, electroanalytical chemistry, voltammetric sensors, electrochemical energy storage, atomic layer deposition, and nanomaterials. With a strong background in electrochemical techniques, she focuses on developing advanced materials and sensors for energy and analytical applications.

speaker: Prof. Abhijit Sarkar
description: Dr. Abhijit Sarkar is a Professor at IIT Madras with a PhD from the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore (2009). His research spans acoustics and vibration, focusing on mathematical formulation and analytical solutions in dynamics and acoustics. He has made significant contributions to the understanding of dispersion characteristics in structural acoustic waveguides, vortex-induced vibrations, and the dynamics of rotating structures.

speaker: Dr. Prithviraj Mukhopadhyay
description: Dr. Prithviraj Makopadhyay is an Assistant Professor at IIT Delhi with a Ph.D. in Manufacturing Engineering from IIT Madras (October 2019). He completed his M.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from ISM Dhanbad (now IIT Dhanbad) in 2014 and his B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering in 2012. His research interests lie in Materials and Manufacturing, including Machining, Tool Development, Joining, and Surface Coating Technology.

speaker: Prof. Ramesh Singh
description: Dr. Ramesh Singh is the G. K. Devarajulu Chair Professor in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at IIT Bombay, Mumbai, India. He earned his Ph.D. (2007) from the Georgia Institute of Technology, an M.S. (2002) from Tufts University, and a B.E. (1997) from Birla Institute of Technology Mesra. His research spans high-speed micromachining, flexible reconfigurable fiber laser-based materials processing, systems integration, and finite element modeling. He has pioneered the development of Indiaâ€™s first high-speed micromachining center and has contributed significantly to chatter detection in machining using advanced signal processing and machine learning. His lab also works on sustainable laser additive restoration, advanced manufacturing systems for industry, and multiscale modeling of damage evolution in composites.

speaker: Dr. Sudarshan Ghosh
description: Dr. Sudarsan Ghosh is an Associate Professor in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at IIT Delhi. His research focuses on advanced manufacturing processes, including the grinding of ceramics and superalloys, the machining of titanium alloys, and surface engineering. He is also actively involved in sustainable machining techniques using nanofluids and solid lubricants and the fabrication of metallic foams.
